content: The Lord’s Supper

Now before the Passover Feast, Jesus knew that His hour had come [and it was time] for Him to leave this world  return to the Father. Having [greatly] loved His own who were in the world, He loved them [and continuously loves them with His perfect love] to the end (eternally).
It was during supper, when the devil had already put [the thought of] betraying Jesus into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son,
that Jesus, knowing that the Father had put everything into His hands, and that He had come from God and was [now] returning to God,
got up from supper, took off His [outer] robe, and taking a [servant’s] towel, He tied it around His waist.
Jesus Washes the Disciples’ Feet
Then He poured water into the basin and began washing the disciples’ feet and wiping them with the towel which was tied around His waist.
When He came to Simon Peter, he said to Him, “Lord, are You going to wash my feet?”
Jesus replied to him,  [fully]
Peter said to Him, “You will never wash my feet!” Jesus answered,  [we can have nothing to do with each other].”
Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, [in that case, wash] not only my feet, but also my hands and my head!”
Jesus said to him,  [My disciples]
For He knew who was going to betray Him; for that reason He said,

So when He had washed their feet and put on His [outer] robe and reclined  again, He said to them,     [this as]  [in turn]    [happy and favored by God]  [and faithfully do them].  [this has happened]  [as My enemy].’  [what will happen]  [who I say I am—the Christ, the Anointed, the Messiah].  [in that same way].”
Jesus Predicts His Betrayal
After Jesus had said these things, He was troubled in spirit, and testified and said,
The disciples  looking at one another, puzzled  disturbed as to whom He could mean.
One of His disciples, whom Jesus loved (esteemed), was leaning against Jesus’ chest.
So Simon Peter motioned to him (John) and [quietly] asked [him to ask Jesus] of whom He was speaking.
Then leaning back against Jesus’ chest, he (John) asked Him [privately], “Lord, who is it?”
Jesus answered,  [of bread]  So when He had dipped the piece of bread [into the dish], He gave it to Judas,  of Simon Iscariot.
After [Judas had taken] the piece of bread, Satan entered him. Then Jesus said to him,  [without delay].”
But no one reclining  knew why He said  to him.
Some thought that, since Judas [as the treasurer of the group] had the money box, Jesus was telling him, “Buy what we need for the feast,” or that he was to give something to the poor.
After taking the piece of bread, he went out immediately; and it was night.
So when Judas had left, Jesus said,  [the time for]  [to be]    [only]
Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus answered,
Peter said to Him, “Lord, why cannot I follow You now? I will lay down my life for You!”
Jesus answered,  [really]
